channel.title: Valery Ozenne
channel.description:
Reproducible Science is good.
Replicated Science is better.

item.title: A blog article has been published in le journal CNRS on our latest work.
item.description:
Our article “New analytical and hybrid heat transfer models for thermal ablation procedures validated by MRI thermometry” has been accepted at International Journal of Hyperthermia. A blog article has been published in the CNRS journal on our latest work.

link to the article

item.title: Presenting at the TractAnat Club
item.description:
Presenting at the TractAnat Club, how cardiac cell structure influences MRI diffusion signals.

link to the youtube video

item.title: Attending the 1stLow-Field MRI conference in Bordeaux
item.description:
The 1st International Conference on the Use of Low and Ultra-low Field MRI for Cohort Imaging in Neuroepidemiology is organised by our lab (the CRMSB) and the VBHI. This conference will be held in Bordeaux from 25 to 26 November 2025.

link to the conference website

item.title: Attending the ESRMRB conference in Marseille
item.description:
The biannual conference of the European Society for Magnetic Resonance in Medicine and Biology (ESMRMB). The bi-annual conference will be held in Marseille from 8 to 11 October 2025. The following five contributions will be presented:

-

- - -

item.title: Manon Deslides is joining the SMART-HEAT projet
item.description: Karoline Honorato Araujo is doing her master 1 internship over the summer 2025 period. She will develop deep-learning segmentation methods for abdominal imaging. We welcome her to Bordeaux.

item.title: Grant proposal accepted, hourra! "
item.description: Our ANR grant proposal THERMOLYSE between MITOVASC (Angers), PRISM (Angers) and CRMSB (Bordeaux) has been accepted.

item.title: Karoline Honorato Araujo is joining the team
item.description: Karoline Honorato Araujo is doing her master 1 internship over the summer 2025 period. She will develop deep-learning segmentation methods for abdominal imaging. We welcome her to Bordeaux.

item.title: Journée SFT dedicated to reduced model in heat transfert modeling
item.description: I’ll attend at Paris the “journée SFT” Société Française de Thermique dedicated to reduced model in heat transfert modeling.

item.title: Visit of the Sherbrooke Connectivity Imaging Lab (SCIL)
item.description: I’m visiting the Sherbrooke Connectivity Imaging Lab (SCIL) for a week. Many thanks to Maxime Descoteaux, François Rheault and all members of SCIL.

item.title: I’ve been invited by the SFRMBM to give a course on phase imaging.
item.description: I’ve been invited by the SFRMBM in Saint-Malo to give a 45 min course on phase imaging.
